column1: Heuristic Voting as Ordinal Dominance Strategies

column2: Reshef Meir@Technion â€“ Israel Institute of Technology

column1: AAAI Technical Track: Game Theory and Economic Paradigms
Decision making under uncertainty is a key component of many AI settings
column2: and in particular of voting scenarios where strategic agents are trying to reach a joint decision. The common approach to handle uncertainty is by maximizing expected utility
column3: which requires a cardinal utility function as well as detailed probabilistic information. However
column4: often such probabilities are not easy to estimate or apply.
